page.title: 19BUILDING DEVELOPMENTS
page.content: Not many new houses are built today as our area is already quite built up, and the majority of the buildings date from the 1920's. About 13% of the land in our Domesday block is covered by major transport routes (M1,railway lines and major roads). A further 32% is occupied by parks and playing fields . The remaining land-cover is chiefly residential and commercial, with a small amount of industry. Much of the new building is carried out to improve and modernise the older houses.However, Moorlands Ave. is an example of new development. This was once a piece of unused allotment ground. In 1978 the Council reviewed this, and by 1980 there was a scheme for 20 new houses. These have four rooms upstairs and four downstairs. Two new industrial estates have also just been built in the Mill Hill area.
